Reviews.Title: Simple installation, great features
Reviews.Author: T. Creek
Reviews.Content: I tested this camera for a few days just sitting out on my desk before mounting it up high in my basement.  I have it connected to a blue iris monitoring server. It's been running for a couple of weeks and all is well. The only issue I've noticed is that the camera didn't boot correctly when I rebooted the Cisco ASA5505 firewall that is a providing its power. I suspect that is due to the short cycle time of the port during the reboot.The field of view is good. Pan and tilt function are smooth and quiet. Having power over Ethernet is the big selling feature for me, as I don't want to have to install a bunch of injectors. I do have a fair amount of cat5 wire in my house, so I can reach the locations that will support cameras and not have to resort to wireless.It would be nice if white was a color option.

Reviews.Title: firmware not so good
Reviews.Author: bgood
Reviews.Content: Basic PoE camera. Foscam support is lacking and the firmware is poorly managed. Camera servers the purpose of what I want, but buyer beware of security issues if you put this online over the Internet.Since it is PoE the advertised picture is incorrect as the unit does not have an antenna as shown on Amazon.

Reviews.Title: I've had no real issues, but.
Reviews.Author: Chris.
Reviews.Content: I bought 4 of these cameras for a DIY home security system. I have 2 up outside (exposed to the elements but under the roof overhang) and 2 inside. the construction/plastic seem a bit low grade thus it seems a little fragile (I would expect it to be destroyed if dropped from any reasonable distance onto a hard surface.) I have a small PC setup running iSpy (excellent freeware surveillance software) that is linked to the cameras and mic's with motion triggering. Works flawlessly! but in huge part to the software which does support this camera, and its pan/tilt feature.They work good overall, I used in combination with the TP-LINK TL-POE150S to send power as I did not want to run AC through the house to each camera. Performance is questionable but ok, they work and have been running 24/7 for the last month with no issues but best I can get out of them is around 9 fps with 6 fps average. I can't seem to get the camera to run any faster (maybe my setup related but I believe the holdup is with the camera.) I did have some additional performance issues with my outside ones during the day. I have a lot of trees and bushes etc. in the picture and a little wind and some sunlight creating a lot of shade spots there ends up being a lot of movement in the video and when viewing via its internal web page at max resolution (640x480 which is pretty low already) it would freeze and I would have to power cycle the camera. (this did not happen at a lower resolution.) and a restart would always restore the picture after it botted back up, though it would freeze again if to much movement in picture. Viewing it at the same resolution with the same amount of movement in the picture over the surveillance software did not have issues or freezing.I found that if you want to connect to it directly to view the feed, using firefox and the cameras  "Server Push Mode" was far better than trying to get IE to work with it (which is oddly what is recommended?)Overall it was worth the cost and setup was easy, the free software I used 'iSpy' supports the cameras including the pan/tilt so I have no complaints. It works and I hope it keeps working for a long time.

Reviews.Title: Wow this is bad.
Reviews.Author: rnaconsulting
Reviews.Content: Foscam should have recalled their defective cameras that are known to reboot under certain busy scenes and lighting conditions so that buyers won't be wasting their time debugging the cameras for them. We are switching to another brand, that's it for me. It is unethical if not criminal to continue to sell products that are known to have the same manufacturing defect for years. Google it and you will find this problem exists for certain batches of Foscam cameras. We went through some 9-10 cameras of different models with the same problem. However, some older cameras that we purchased a few years ago worked great.

Reviews.Title: Product is not reliable
Reviews.Author: F. LI
Reviews.Content: Bought two of these.  cannot connect to the camera server after several hours.  Had to contactly unplug and plug the power to make the web server available again.  Dispointed because it is a good product other than this problem.

Reviews.Title: Solid, fantastic value, but a bit tricky to set up
Reviews.Author: Matthew R. Mayfield
Reviews.Content: For the price, these are spectacular. I use mine to minitor my twin babies. I use it with 2 iPhones, iPad, and 2 computers with low coat 3rd party apps. Great at night, audio ok, pan&tilt; silent and reliable.Setup and support feels more like open source. MAC addresses are mislabeled (wifi vs eithernet), They assume you know about DHCP reservations and port forwarding on your specific router. Included tools are limited and primitive. Plan a full day to set it up, but worth it for me. (Port forwarding and access outside my home never worked for me)

Reviews.Title: Wow!  My First Camera works perfectly
Reviews.Author: David Higgins
Reviews.Content: I say wow since I always thought that night vision that actually worked was really expensive.  I did a test and turned off the light in one of my bedrooms which has this camera and it is completely dark.  I turned on night vision and I can actually see everything in the room clearly as if a huge flashlight is coming from the camera!  The quality is great and I can rotate the camera how I please.  I read another review where someone said it uses too much bandwidth, so I will have to test that out once I leave.  The software could add such a feature and a zoom option as well.  Still a great product, I plan to buy more.

Reviews.Title: Nice Basic IP POE Camera
Reviews.Author: Gelato
Reviews.Content: I bought a couple of these to supplement a couple of FI8910W's that are located inside my house.  I have the 8910E's sitting outside under cantilevered sections of roof where they are not exposed to the elements.  Although it remains to be seen whether they will hold up in a New York winter cold spell.  Setup was a breeze although I had months of experience with the 8910W's.  Everything is run through a Blue Iris server which really should be required software when buying these cameras.  POE is supplied through a Trendnet TPE-S44 switch.  The only drawbacks I have found is one does not handle dawn lighting very well and green leaves on trees appear orange/yellow.  Also, the lens angles are not wide enough.  Otherwise, these are great.

Reviews.Title: Unreliable
Reviews.Author: Syzygy
Reviews.Content: For years I have been using (and enjoying) several non-POE Foscam cameras in 24x7 surveillance, using third party POE splitters to power most of them from a Netgear POE switch. (Five stars for those cameras.) Bought two of these POE units to help simplify things, though. The first one died after a week (couldn't get a refund from Amazon because I was out of town beyond the 30 days). The second unit became flakey (spontaneously going off-line) after about 7 weeks and a firmware update provided no improvement. No refund was available in this case either, because it was past 30 days.

Reviews.Title: Cheap and does the job...
Reviews.Author: Rubber Duck
Reviews.Content: I only give it 4 stars because it's so cheap... this is the low end stuff. Relative to proper surveillance cameras, the quality of Foscam is mediocre. However, it's probably the best quality of the low-end cameras, and it definitely does the job. Foscam also integrates well with many software solutions... it's just a very widespread product.The main problem I had with this camera is that it occasionally disappears from the network - as if it dies but then later comes back to life somehow. I'm an experienced network administrator, and all of my debugging pointed at a camera problem. Rebooting or reconnecting the camera fixes the problem, but my application involved remote surveillance (over the internet), so I couldn't physically reboot/reconnect the camera.

Reviews.Title: very good
Reviews.Author: Robert Kruthaupt
Reviews.Content: for the price of this camera I cannot complain.good night vision and easy to setupPOE reduces the wiring and makes the connection more stable

Reviews.Title: Works great with Blue Iris
Reviews.Author: Theodore E Gardiner
Reviews.Content: Been using for four months now...works great.  I live in a tropical country and have it outdoors under a roof and protected from rain.  Absolutely no problems with overheating as some foscam units are reputed to do.  Easy enough to configure and use with an android remote viewing program and with blue iris NVR software.  I am able to see the image and control the pan/tilt over the internet from 10000 miles away.  Night vision is better than any of my other analog or digital cameras, and day image quality is good.  POE is the essential feature that set this camera apart from all the rest and compelled me to buy it.  Just wish it had higher resolution.

Reviews.Title: Great product and even better service!
Reviews.Author: Anthony Scaccianoce
Reviews.Content: These cameras are wonderful. They are inexpensive and have an amazing range of features. This technology was unheard of just a few years ago. Now I can view my home from my phone anytime. I had the pleasure of speaking with Foscam to set up a new router to my cameras. I spoke to Jees from the India call center. He was amazingly efficient and his knowlege was like that of a Wizard! Thanks Foscam for a great product and even better customer service!Don't try to set up these cameras yourself, swallow your pride and have the pros at Foscam do it for you!

Reviews.Title: Great picture and great support!
Reviews.Author: John R.
Reviews.Content: I just purchased this IP camera and the setup was confusing to me however, the representative was able to set me up in no time at all and get my camera working! very helpful support and great picture!

Reviews.Title: Met expectation
Reviews.Author: Forest Mitchell Felling
Reviews.Content: I bought several of these cameras to use to monitor common areas inside my home.  I am in IT, and I found the camera's easy to configure and set-up.  I would caution that if you are not network savvy there may be a learning curve in certain aspects of the set-up.

Reviews.Title: Great Cameras
Reviews.Author: M.H. "Mello"
Reviews.Content: I have bought several of these cameras to use in our Restaurants.  Works great with the Blue Iris software.  Very good quality picture and I love the fact that you can pan, tilt and zoom.

Reviews.Title: technical support
Reviews.Author: Steven Howarth
Reviews.Content: Calvin helped restore the wireless setting for the camera, very helpful and router is now working.good camera to use remotely to see our baby!

Reviews.Title: Post sale support
Reviews.Author: Benny
Reviews.Content: Worked with Calvin at Foscam to help set up my wireless and link to access outside my network.  He logged into my computer and handled everything very quickly and professionally.  Very satisfied.

Reviews.Title: Simple, inexpensive, wonderful.
Reviews.Author: E. Kisbey
Reviews.Content: This is pretty much the perfect cheap PoE camera -- I'm now up to four of these around the property.  The resolution isn't stellar, but the light sensitivity and feature set are first class.  It's by far the best camera I've tried in low and zero-illumination scenarios.  Color response is decent, and frame rate is acceptable for a security or monitoring application, though it may not be your first choice for video-conferencing.I've had a few of these mounted outdoors under the eaves of various buildings for nearly a year now, with no issues or degradation in performance.  The web-controlled pan & tilt are imprecise and a bit slow, but the fact that it sees in total darkness, has a built-in microphone, and all of it is available through the GUI, makes up for the very few shortcomings.The manufacturer makes an outdoor dome for these, though the dome interferes with the IR capability.  Frankly, the LED's aren't strictly necessary, as the low-light performance of this camera pretty good even without the illumination.  Mine are unprotected but at this price point, they're almost disposable.Tip: If you're using a DVR setup, ensure your software can handle a JPEG stream before buying this -- that caused me some headaches and I actually ended up switching DVR platforms to keep the cameras.  Also, get the new firmware; there are stability issues with the earlier firmware releases.Overall, I strongly recommend these, particularly in a monitoring role for dim lighting scenarios, such as a barn or a garage.

Reviews.Title: Good camera with one huge problem
Reviews.Author: Sean
Reviews.Content: I've gone through 3 of these cameras from 2 different vendors (Foscam US included), and they all have same issue: when exposed to certain pattern/light conditions, they reset.  And if the "image" that caused the camera to reset is within the boot sequence movement, it just gets stuck in an endless loop of reboots as it continuously hits the "image."The problem was supposedly fixed in new stock, but I haven't found a good one yet.The camera itself works great.  PoE works perfectly.  It's a shame that it's got such a killer bug.

Reviews.Title: Great cameras at the price and easy to setup
Reviews.Author: Robindranath Maharaj
Reviews.Content: Great cameras, that pan, tilt and feature rich. I have the alerts for motion setup to email me and record. Takes some tweaking depending on the environment but works great. The POE option is the way to go, minimize on the cabling to run for the cameras. I already have 6 of these and buying more.

Reviews.Title: Good mix of features
Reviews.Author: J. Patterson
Reviews.Content: So I've used the Foscam F18910W quite a bit, but this was my first try with POE on this model.  I needed it for a small business install using Cisco POE switches.  So far it has worked out great.  I loved these little cameras already, and the POE in this instance made things so much easier than using Wifi and having to run Power to all the locations I needed to place them.  Much easier to just run Cat6 and call it good.  I won't get too much into the features as I already knew I liked them, but it is a full featured camera that plays well with software like BlueIris for recording.  It also plays well with android smartphones for the full range of functions including both audio listening and speaking (although for speaking you really need to be on the internal network to get much to come across very well).

Reviews.Title: Solid IP Camera
Reviews.Author: King H
Reviews.Content: Meets all expectations.  Audio and video is clear enough, and it works with my home automation system.  Way to go FOSCAM.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for the $
Reviews.Author: Rolly Lagman
Reviews.Content: Great camera for a fraction of the price of others.  Easy to use, easy to install and very clear picture.

Reviews.Title: Camera Doesn't Work Correctly with Email and OSD. Rating 2 and pending
Reviews.Author: Kenny
Reviews.Content: The product is OK but theres' a problem with email. it's sending email every 2 mins. I have sent 2 emails to support@foscam.com to resolve the issue but not have not heard from them. Plus I do not want to register the device going to foscam. It's total against my privacy, The OSD is showing Dec 30 1969. I am putting the rating 2 now, until I hear from them to correct the issue before returning the item.

Reviews.Title: FOSCAM IP Cameras
Reviews.Author: Jam
Reviews.Content: Easy to install locally.  I had difficulty with setting them up to view remotely.  I called the TECH support and withing 5 min had both of my cameras online!  Great friendly Tech Support!

Reviews.Title: Great little device for the price but beware switch and router port no PoE
Reviews.Author: MP
Reviews.Content: This is a great device for the price that I paid.  It's consistent and reliable in operation.  Beware that most of switches/routers that their ports don't have Power Over Ethernet (PoE) so you have to plug the power cord into the power plug.

ProductInfo.Features:
Building on the success of the Foscam FI8918E, the FI8910E is the latest camera from Foscam Digital Technologies LLC.
The distinguishing features of the FI8910W are the embedded IR-Cut off filter, upgraded external housing, wider horizontal panning range and 2 year Warranty.
The IR-cut filter provides true & accurately images fixing the problems related to washed out and discolored images.
ProductInfo.Name: Foscam FI8910E Power Over Ethernet (POE) Pan and Tilt IP/Network Camera and 3.6mm Lens - Black
